channel.title: Residual stress on Artur L Gower
channel.description: Recent content in Residual stress on Artur L Gower

item.title: The constitutive relations of initially stressed incompressible Mooney-Rivlin materials
item.description: Illustrates how the virtual stress-free state relates to a formulation purely in terms of stress tensors. B0 is virtual stress-free state, B1 is the initially stressed configuration with internal stress τ, and B2 is the current configuration with Cauchy stress σ.

item.title: Morphology of residually stressed tubular tissues: Beyond the elastic multiplicative decomposition
item.description: Illustrates the kind of wrinkling instabilities that appear for different distributions of residual stress. These studies can help explain the morphology of tubular structures. For a growing tissue, like our intestine, to form a specific type of wrinkle, it need only generate the right kind of stress, then the tube will spontaneously wrinkle.
